@ Zooeliten
its similar to lossless audio version... 320kbs is about the highest sample rate you can get realistically (i.e. the computer takes a "sample" of the soundwave at an exactly equally spaced interval 320 times per second to reproduce a digital soundwave that is then reproduced by the speakers). lossless or flac are, if you like, images... produced of the soundwave and thus represent an exact copy of the original soundwave made by the music. in all honesty, nobody who doesnt have 4000w speakers or is frekishly into music could tell the difference between 320kbs and flac or lossless but some people just prefer it.

Only took a few minutes! Quality is fine.
